channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
item.description: Read about our columnists’ favorite and least-favorite stocks and see how they performed.

item.title: The U.S. economy is getting closer to a recession. What is the Fed waiting for?
item.description: The Fed should cut rates by 0.5% before the Jackson Hole meeting in late August, says Investment manager Louis Navellier.

item.title: The Score: CrowdStrike, Apple, Intel and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: The market has a sinking feeling that the Fed has fallen behind the curve
item.description: The coming central-bank pivot won’t usher in a mere solo rate cut but a rate-cutting campaign.

item.title: Growth Fears Rattle Markets; Nasdaq Suffers Correction
item.description: A summer swoon in the stock market intensified Friday after a disappointing jobs report renewed worries about slowing growth.

item.title: ‘Inside Out 2’ success is AMC’s saving grace in second quarter
item.description: AMC reported a quarterly loss in line with forecasts, saying it saw a boost from Disney’s “Inside Out 2.”

item.title: What Bill Ackman Got Wrong With His Bungled IPO
item.description: One of the world’s most celebrated hedge-fund managers just pulled the plug on a new fund. He might have gotten a warmer welcome if the deal had been better for all.

item.title: Nasdaq enters correction territory as recession fears slam stocks
item.description: Friday’s stock-market pullback saw the Nasdaq Composite enter correction territory.

item.title: AI vs. Financial Analysts: Who Is Better at Predicting Earnings of Public Companies?
item.description: A new study finds that, once again, large language models can outperform humans. But not in certain situations.

item.title: Stocks rocked by surprisingly soft U.S. jobs report as Nasdaq slides into correction
item.description: Investors dumped U.S. stocks on Friday, after a softer-than-expected jobs report heightened worries over slowing economic growth.
